articles.headline: Biden Orders Sanctions on 4 Israelis Over West Bank Violence
articles.snippet: The order served as both a sharp-edged diplomatic notice to Israel and a message to Arab Americans, a key part of the political coalition the president needs to be re-elected.
articles.abstract: The order served as both a sharp-edged diplomatic notice to Israel and a message to Arab Americans, a key part of the political coalition the president needs to be re-elected.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden on Thursday ordered broad financial and travel sanctions on Israeli settlers accused of violent attacks on Palestinians in the West Bank, a forceful gesture aimed in part at Arab American voters in the United States who have expressed fury about the president’s backing of Israel’s war in Gaza.

articles.headline: Biden Takes Aim at Grocery Chains Over Food Prices
articles.snippet: President Biden has begun to accuse stores of overcharging shoppers, as food costs remain a burden for consumers and a political problem for the president.
articles.abstract: President Biden has begun to accuse stores of overcharging shoppers, as food costs remain a burden for consumers and a political problem for the president.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden, whose approval rating has suffered amid high inflation, is beginning to pressure large grocery chains to slash food prices for American consumers, accusing the stores of reaping excess profits and ripping off shoppers.

articles.headline: Amazon Enters Chatbot Fray With Shopping Tool
articles.snippet: The tech giant introduced the Rufus chatbot. It has lagged behind others on introducing consumer-facing generative artificial intelligence.
articles.abstract: The tech giant introduced the Rufus chatbot. It has lagged behind others on introducing consumer-facing generative artificial intelligence.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon entered the consumer chatbot fray on Thursday, announcing a new artificial intelligence personal shopping assistant as the company races to catch up with other tech giants.

articles.headline: India’s Quiet Push to Steal More of China’s iPhone Business
articles.snippet: The companies that make iPhones are bringing their factories to one corner of India, to graft them onto a network of manufacturers.
articles.abstract: The companies that make iPhones are bringing their factories to one corner of India, to graft them onto a network of manufacturers.
articles.lead_paragraph: India is quietly grabbing from China more manufacturing of Apple’s iPhones and other electronics gear.

articles.headline: Cleaning Latrines by Hand: ‘How Could Any Human Do That?’
articles.snippet: Bezwada Wilson, born into a caste tasked with manually removing dried human waste, has spent 40 years trying to eradicate the practice and retrain workers.
articles.abstract: Bezwada Wilson, born into a caste tasked with manually removing dried human waste, has spent 40 years trying to eradicate the practice and retrain workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: When he came to fully realize exactly what his parents and older brother did for a living, and what it likely meant for his own future, Bezwada Wilson says he was so angry he contemplated suicide.

articles.headline: Dual Mission for Macy’s New Chief: Revive Stores and Fend Off Takeover
articles.snippet: Tony Spring, a Bloomingdale’s veteran, assumes the top job as an investor group threatens to take a buyout bid to shareholders.
articles.abstract: Tony Spring, a Bloomingdale’s veteran, assumes the top job as an investor group threatens to take a buyout bid to shareholders.
articles.lead_paragraph: As he prepares to take the reins as Macy’s chief executive on Sunday, Tony Spring has a tall order: He must contend with the existential crisis that mall-based department stores are facing to try to stay relevant in an increasingly e-commerce world.
articles.byline: By Jordyn Holman and Lauren Hirsch

articles.headline: A Suddenly Media-Shy Speaker Can’t Answer Questions. He’s on the Phone.
articles.snippet: Speaker Mike Johnson, who once routinely stopped for hallway interviews, has taken to pressing his iPhone to his ear as he walks through the Capitol, avoiding questions as he navigates a tough new job.
articles.abstract: Speaker Mike Johnson, who once routinely stopped for hallway interviews, has taken to pressing his iPhone to his ear as he walks through the Capitol, avoiding questions as he navigates a tough new job.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was his first day back in Washington after a long winter break, and Speaker Mike Johnson was under pressure to pass a short-term funding bill to avoid a government shutdown within days.

articles.headline: Young Filmmaker Lives His ‘Fairy Tale’ at Sundance
articles.snippet: Sean Wang, a first-time director, received an audience award for his coming-of-age film, “Dìdi.” He also got the ultimate prize: a distribution deal.
articles.abstract: Sean Wang, a first-time director, received an audience award for his coming-of-age film, “Dìdi.” He also got the ultimate prize: a distribution deal.
articles.lead_paragraph: “I feel like I’m in a fairy tale,” Sean Wang said to the sold-out crowd gathered at the Ray Theater in Park City, Utah, last month for his Sundance Film Festival debut.
articles.byline: By Nicole Sperling and Joel Barhamand

articles.headline: What You Can Still Complain About in Russia: A Cat Thrown From a Train
articles.snippet: The death of a pet during a train journey has given Russians a safe space to speak out and connect, and allowed the Kremlin to shift attention from wartime gloom.
articles.abstract: The death of a pet during a train journey has given Russians a safe space to speak out and connect, and allowed the Kremlin to shift attention from wartime gloom.
articles.lead_paragraph: The tragedy gripped Russia for days. Federal lawmakers convened a special committee and an investigation was launched, as hundreds of volunteers searched for the victim in subzero temperatures, and state news media ran live updates on the fallout.

articles.headline: A New Perk for Some Student Loan Borrowers: A 401(k) Match
articles.snippet: Legislation that went into effect this year makes it easier for student loan borrowers to save for retirement while paying down their debt.
articles.abstract: Legislation that went into effect this year makes it easier for student loan borrowers to save for retirement while paying down their debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: Student loan borrowers who are lucky enough to have access to a 401(k)-type plan, but are too stretched to save in it, may soon be helped by a new workplace benefit: Paying off their student loans can generate retirement savings contributions from their employer.

articles.headline: Job Market Starts 2024 With a Bang
articles.snippet: U.S. employers added 353,000 jobs in January, far exceeding forecasts, and revised figures showed last year was even stronger than previously reported.
articles.abstract: U.S. employers added 353,000 jobs in January, far exceeding forecasts, and revised figures showed last year was even stronger than previously reported.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States produced an unexpectedly sizable batch of jobs last month, a boon for American workers that shows the labor market retains remarkable strength after three years of expansion.
